page.title: 09CATFORTH W.I.
page.content: There are fifty members of the Catforth Womens Institute, with an average of thirty two members attending the monthly meetings held in the village hall, on the first Wednesday of the month at 7.30 p.m. The meeting opens with the singing of Jerusalem. The minutes of the last meeting are read, business, correspondence and matters arising are discussed. The talk or demonstration by a guest 'speaker' lasts forty five minutes , the subject can vary from cookery to renovating furniture. The monthly competition is then judged by the 'speaker' the winner and two others gain points for the Sally Lawson trophy awarded annually. A raffle is held for W.I. funds. Supper is then served, and the meeting closes at 10 p.m. with the singing of the National Anthem.
